Card.Name: Llanowar Elves
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {G}.

Card.Name: Birds of Paradise
Card.RulesText: Flying {T}: Add one mana of any color.

Card.Name: Fyndhorn Elves
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add {G}.

Card.Name: Kavu Titan
Card.RulesText: Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.) If Kavu Titan was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it and with trample.

Card.Name: Utopia Tree
Card.RulesText: {T}: Add one mana of any color.

Card.Name: Thornscape Familiar
Card.RulesText: Red spells and white spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

Card.Name: River Boa
Card.RulesText: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.) {G}: Regenerate River Boa.

Card.Name: Albino Troll
Card.RulesText: Echo {1}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.) {1}{G}: Regenerate Albino Troll.

Card.Name: Monk Realist
Card.RulesText: When Monk Realist enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.

Card.Name: Lone Wolf
Card.RulesText: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

Card.Name: Blastoderm
Card.RulesText: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.) Fading 3 (This creature enters the battlefield with three fade counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a fade counter from it. If you can't, sacrifice it.)

Card.Name: Charging Troll
Card.RulesText: Vigilance {G}: Regenerate Charging Troll.

Card.Name: Oracle of Mul Daya
Card.RulesText: You may play an additional land on each of your turns. Play with the top card of your library revealed. You may play lands from the top of your library.

Card.Name: Serra Angel
Card.RulesText: Flying, vigilance

Card.Name: Baneslayer Angel
Card.RulesText: Flying, first strike, lifelink, protection from Demons and from Dragons

Card.Name: Sabertooth Nishoba
Card.RulesText: Trample, protection from blue and from red

Card.Name: Rancor
Card.RulesText: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample. When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.

Card.Name: Mulch
Card.RulesText: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

Card.Name: Swords To Plowshares
Card.RulesText: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

Card.Name: Disenchant
Card.RulesText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

Card.Name: Pariah
Card.RulesText: Enchant creature All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.

Card.Name: Armadillo Cloak
Card.RulesText: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample. Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

Card.Name: Kismet
Card.RulesText: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

Card.Name: Might of Oaks
Card.RulesText: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

Card.Name: Armageddon
Card.RulesText: Destroy all lands.

Card.Name: Wrath of God
Card.RulesText: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

Card.Name: Rout
Card.RulesText: You may cast Rout as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.) Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

Card.Name: Cursed Scroll
Card.RulesText: {3}, {T}: Choose a card name, then reveal a card at random from your hand. If that card has the chosen name, Cursed Scroll deals 2 damage to any target.

Card.Name: Savannah
Card.RulesText: ({T}: Add {G} or {W}.)

Card.Name: Windswept Heath
Card.RulesText: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Windswept Heath: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.

Card.Name: Treetop Village
Card.RulesText: Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped. {T}: Add {G}. {1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
